Pre-Game Insights: The Minnesota Twins (72-61) will try to beat the Toronto Blue Jays (65-70) at Target Field on Saturday.
The pitchers taking the mound are Jose Berrios and Zebby Matthews.
As a unit, the Toronto Blue Jays are notching 4.2 runs per game, which has them sitting at 22nd in baseball.
The Blue Jays have compiled a team earned run average of 4.42 for the season (25th in baseball).
The Minnesota Twins have accounted for an OBP of .322 as well as a team batting average of .253 on the year.
Minnesota has knocked in 162 home runs this season as well as 611 RBIs.
The Twins hold a team WHIP of 1.180 and are the owners of a FIP of 3.83 as a staff over the course of the season.
